entry.title: Philippe I, Duke of Orléans (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Philippe I, Duke of Orléans, (pictured) was the father of two queens and a French regent, despite preferring his male lovers to his wives?

entry.title: a 65-minute concert film (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a 65-minute concert film starring Billie Eilish was filmed all in one week?

entry.title: Tom Alberg (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Seattle-based Tom Alberg, one of the earliest investors in Amazon, was convinced of the company's promise when he could not find a book by Peter Drucker in his local bookstore?

entry.title: Semi-Detached, Suburban Mr. James (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Manfred Mann's 1966 single "Semi-Detached, Suburban Mr. James" was amongst the first songs to utilize the Mellotron?

entry.title: Louisa Shafia (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a New York pop-up restaurant opened by Louisa Shafia served stews and rice dishes described in a review as a "Persian-tapas gateway into the ancient cuisine"?

entry.title: Iranian operation to liberate the town of Bostan (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Iranian operation to liberate the town of Bostan during the Iran–Iraq War was described by Ruhollah Khomeini, then Supreme Leader of Iran, as "the victory of victories"?

entry.title: Aaron S. Watkin (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that Aaron S. Watkin is scheduled to become the artistic director of the English National Ballet three decades after he first danced there?

entry.title: a Texas radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that one DJ of a Texas radio station challenged another to a cow-milking contest on the streets of the city?
